description: Update relevant documentation to reflect the changes in how DelegateManager is initialized and used across the system.
instructions: Locate the section(s) related to message handling, system output, or any place where user-facing messages are generated or processed.
Update these sections to explain the role of the `DelegateManager` in handling user-facing messages.
Clearly describe how modules and commands should obtain and use an instance of the `DelegateManager` to send messages.
Add a new section or update an existing one to explain the `pause` and `end` functionality provided by the `DelegateManager`.
Detail how modules and commands can integrate with this pause/end functionality, including how to check the state and respond accordingly.
Ensure the documentation is clear, concise, and provides practical examples where necessary.
Review the updated documentation for accuracy and clarity, ensuring it aligns with the implemented `DelegateManager` logic.
constraints: Updates must be made only to the specified documentation file (`docs/developer_guide.md`).
The documentation must accurately reflect the current implementation of the `DelegateManager`.
validation_criteria: The documentation explains how to initialize and obtain an instance of `DelegateManager`.
The documentation describes the purpose and usage of `DelegateManager` for user-facing messages.
The documentation explains the `pause` and `end` functionality of the `DelegateManager`.
The documentation provides instructions on how modules/commands should integrate with the `pause`/`end` functionality.
The updated documentation is easy to understand and navigate.
name: update_documentation
